discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
It;s the only one that can be used for fiber

Selected Answer: A
A. Fiber Distribution Panel: Used to organize and manage fiber optic cables, ideal for routing to multimode uplinks.

B. 110 punchdown block: A type of terminal block used primarily for copper wiring, not suitable for fiber optics.

C. PDU (Power Distribution Unit): Distributes electrical power, not used for managing data cables.

D. TIA/EIA-568A patch bay: A patch panel following a specific wiring standard, typically used for copper Ethernet cables, not fiber optics.

E. Cat 6 patch panel: Used to manage and organize Category 6 Ethernet cables, not suitable for fiber optics.

questions.question_text: Which of the following should be used to manage outside cables that need to be routed to various multimode uplinks?

Staff members notify a network technician that the wireless network is not working as expected and connectivity to wireless devices is intermittent. Some devices connect but then disconnect. The technician reviews the logs on the WAP controller and identifies thousands of connection attempts from unrecognized devices within a short amount of time. Which of the following is the most likely reason for the wireless network connectivity issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Denial of service
The high number of connection attempts from unrecognized devices in a short amount of time suggests a Denial of Service (DoS) attack, which can overwhelm the network and cause connectivity issues for legitimate devices.

questions.question_text: A user is connecting a smartwatch to a smartphone for internet access. Which of the following network types is the user employing?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
PAN (Personal Area Network) = Bluetooth - short range of 10m

questions.question_text: An online gaming company needs a cloud solution that will allow for more virtual resources to be deployed when tournaments are held. The number of users who access the service increases during tournaments. The company also needs the resources to return to baseline levels once the resources are not needed in order to reduce cost. Which of the following cloud concepts would provide the best solution?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Elasticity - horizontal resource addition - Temp solution
Scalability - Vertical resource addition - long term solution.

Selected Answer: D
I think of scalabilit as 'planning for future events in the need of', and elasticity as being live and dynamic expanding and contracting in real time. IDK

Selected Answer: D
Elasticity: Automatically adjusts computing resources based on real-time demand, allowing for dynamic scaling up or down to optimize costs and performance.

Hybrid: Combines different types of cloud environments (such as public and private clouds) to leverage the advantages of each, offering flexibility and scalability.

Scalability: Refers to the ability of a system to handle increased workload by adding resources, either vertically (more powerful hardware) or horizontally (more machines or instances).

Multitenancy: A single instance of software serves multiple customers or tenants, allowing them to share common infrastructure and resources

Selected Answer: A
Collisions = Hubs = layer 1

Selected Answer: A
Layer 1 of the OSI model is the Physical Layer, where network collisions occur. Collisions happen when two devices attempt to send data on the same network segment simultaneously, causing interference. This typically occurs in shared media environments, such as Ethernet hubs or networks using coaxial cables.

questions.question_text: A technician reviews a network performance report and finds a high level of collisions happening on the network. At which of the following layers of the OSI model would these collisions be found?
